did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Subject files and working papers pertaining to the study of southeast Asian languages; also, audiodiscs and audiotapes.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: R. B. Jones was a peer of John Echols and developed the mainland Southeast Asia Program at Cornell. He was a major contributor to the nation's teaching capacity in Burmese, Thai, and Vietnamese languages. His original field is in Karen languages.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Subject files and working papers pertaining to the study of southeast Asian languages; also, audiodiscs and audiotapes.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on our Reproductions and Permissions page.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: R. B. Jones papers. #4901. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
